column1: Address Change Confirmation reflects old address as Updated Address
column31:
When processing an address change for an individual, the confirmation letter that goes to the old address (Letter #2) shows the old address as the Updated Address on File. This letter should be addressed to the old address and show the new address as the Updated Address on File. 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

An owners address was changed 
From: 123 Main Street, Anywhere, TX 12345
To: 654 Easy Street, Somewhere, TX 54321
Letter #1: 
Addressed to the new address at 654 Easy Street, Somewhere, TX 54321
Updated Address on File shows new address as 654 Easy Street, Somewhere, TX 54321

Letter #2:
Addressed to the old address at 123 Main Street, Anywhere, TX 12345
Updated Address on File shows new address as 654 Easy Street, Somewhere, TX 54321

* Employment status
* Occupation

column1: Java Package Management for Custom Libraries
Ability for Agent or Agent Assistant (Admin) to Assign an Application to a Primary Writing Agent
column31:
As an *agent or agent assistant*,
I want to *assign an application to a primary writing agent*,
So that *the assigned agent can view the application on their dashboard and be the only one authorized to submit it*.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

# *Assignment Functionality:*
#* An agent or agent assistant can assign an application to a primary writing agent during or after initiating the application.
# *Dashboard Visibility:*
#* The primary writing agent (assigned agent) sees the application in their dashboard.
#* The original user who started the application (agent or assistant) also sees the application in their dashboard.
# *Submission Permissions:*
#* Only the primary writing agent has the ability to submit the application.
#* If the application is started by someone else (e.g., assistant), they will not see the "Submit" option.

* When a user clicks on the task it routes them to the case to review the funds on the suspense record

column1: Owner Signed At State Error if Not a Launch/Available State
column31:
Documenting this in a new Jira since I can’t find the original; this was also documented in business requirements in January 2025.



The options in Owner’s Signed At State on the Sign and Submit page should include all US states, however signature is not allowed in all states. 

There should be an error that blocks signature if the Owner’s Signed At State is not a state in which Ceres does business. “This application may not be signed in this state due to state availability.”

See AN_MG_502 in the e-App business requirements.



For example, signature may not occur in NY or ID (Ceres is not licensed to do business in these states), nor in FL (MYGA is not approved in FL), nor in NC (Ceres is not opening the MYGA to new business in this state)

column1: Investigate and Design Solution for Sequencing of Events from FAST Platform to Snowflake Raw Layer
column31:
Proactively investigate sequencing of events arriving from the FAST platform into the Snowflake raw layer. This can lead to downstream issues such as incorrect record overwrites, missed updates, or premature processing when events are not ingested in the expected logical order.



The objective of this story is to:

* Investigate the root cause of out-of-order event ingestion
* Determine whether the issue originates in FAST, during transmission, or within the Snowflake pipeline
* Design a solution to ensure proper sequencing or reconciliation logic that maintains data integrity in the raw and harmonized layers

column1: FAST Access Removals
column31:
Ops users currently have the ability to ‘Delete’ multiple functions when they should not be granted access to the delete button for these functions. 

||*Function in FAST*||*FAST VIEW*||*Business Justification*||
|Delete Button for Agent Contract Records|Agent Profile|Ops users should not be able to delete any agent details as it could impact downstream reporting, commissions, and contract processing.|
|Delete Button for Errors and Omissions|Agent Profile|Ops users should not be able to delete any agent details as it could impact downstream reporting, commissions, and contract processing.|
|Delete Button for Carrier Appointment Records|Agent Profile|Ops users should not be able to delete any agent details as it could impact downstream reporting, commissions, and contract processing.|
|Delete Button for Product Training Records|Agent Profile|Ops users should not be able to delete any agent details as it could impact downstream reporting, commissions, and contract processing.|
|Delete Button for Continuing Education Records|Agent Profile|Ops users should not be able to delete any agent details as it could impact downstream reporting, commissions, and contract processing.|
|Delete Button for Customer Details|Customer Profile|Ops users should not be able to delete customer details. Doing so completely deletes the customer profile and removes the ability to view the case.|
|Delete Button for Scheduled Events|Policy|Ops users should not be able to delete scheduled events (cal year end, renewals, etc) as they will not process. Would impact contract data/processing.|
|Delete Button for Suspense Entry Records|Case/Policy|Ops users should not be able to delete money out of suspense. Only Leadership and indexers (Canon) should have delete access in Suspense.|

*Acceptance Criteria:* 

* When navigating to the *Agent Profile view*, the Ops user no longer has the ability to delete Agent Contract Records, Errors and Omission Records, Carrier Appointment Records, Product Training Records, or Continuing Education Records.
* When navigating to the *Customer Profile view*, the Ops user no longer has the ability to delete Customer Details.
* When navigating to the *Policy view*, the Ops user no longer has the ability to delete Scheduled Events.
* When navigating to the *Policy/Case views* the Ops user no longer has the ability to delete Suspense Entry Records.

column1: Add Chargebacks to Withdrawals/Partial Surrenders in First Policy Year
column31:
If there is a withdrawal or partial surrender on a policy within the first 12 months, the agent should be charged a chargeback of commissions on the amount of the withdrawal/partial surrender. 

Months 1-6 = 100% Chargeback
Months 7-12 = 50% Chargeback
Months 13+ = 0% Chargeback

*Acceptance Criteria*: 

* A policy issued May 1, 2025 has a Withdrawal/Partial Surrender processed on July 1st (month 3), a 100% chargeback should be assessed on the amount of the withdrawal/partial surrender.
** Policy issued with $1,000,000
** Commissions Rate at issue = 5%
** Withdrawal of $20,000 causes a chargeback of $1,000
*** (Amt of Withdrawal * Commission Rate at issue) * 100% = $1,000
*** ($20,000 * 0.05) * 1.00 = $1,000
* A policy issued on May 1, 2025 has a Withdrawal/Partial Surrender processed on November 1st (month 7), a 50% chargeback should be assessed on the amount of the withdrawal/partial surrender.
** Policy issued with $1,000,000
** Commissions Rate at issue = 5%
** Withdrawal of $20,000 causes a chargeback of $500
*** (Amt of Withdrawal * Commission Rate at issue) * 50% = $500
*** ($20,000 * 0.05) * 0.50 = $500
* A policy issued on May 1, 2025 has Withdrawal/Partial Surrender processed on May 1, 2026 (month 13), a chargeback should *not* be assessed.

column31:
The commissions extract will now include *negative commission entries* to represent scenarios where commissions are *not paid*. Even in these cases, the XML data structure will remain consistent — i.e., it will still contain a commission block that matches the structure used for positive payments.


The existing pipeline should be able to process this data, this needs to be processed and validated that it is captured as expected.

column1: Ingest 1035 Ceding Carrier FaxNumber via Acord103 - Day 2
column31:
Below is a sample {{Holding}} object for Acord103 Replacement.

{noformat}<Holding id="Replacement_1">
  <HoldingTypeCode tc="2">Policy</HoldingTypeCode>
  <HoldingStatus tc="1">Active</HoldingStatus>
  <Policy>
      <PolNumber>PRU10051</PolNumber>
      <LineOfBusiness tc="2">Annuity</LineOfBusiness>
      <ProductType tc="3013500008">Fixed Annuity</ProductType>
      <ExistingAddress>100 Frank W Burr Boulevard, Teaneck, NJ, 07666</ExistingAddress>
      <CarrierCode>Test Override Company</CarrierCode>
      <PolicyValue>100000</PolicyValue>
      <QualPlanType tc="1">Non-Qualified</QualPlanType>
      <Exchange1035Ind tc="2">External</Exchange1035Ind>
      <ReplCo1035>Yes</ReplCo1035>
      <OLifEExtension VendorCode="598">
        <RepPaymentType tc="2">NQ 1035 Exchange</RepPaymentType>
        <ReplaceOrLikelyToReplaceExistingPolicy>true</ReplaceOrLikelyToReplaceExistingPolicy>
      </OLifEExtension>
  </Policy>
  <Arrangement>
      <ArrType tc="Full">Full</ArrType>
      <PaymentSource tc="Replacement">Replacement</PaymentSource>
  </Arrangement>
</Holding>{noformat}


The eApp will pass the 1035 ceding carrier location address via the {{ExistingAddress}} node. However, the eApp also needs to pass the location’s {{FaxNumber}} . This requires XSLT changes in FAST to ingest the provided FaxNumber into the fax number field in the funding/money sources.

This is needed to support the agent’s ability to override 1035 Fax Numbers

column1: Update Logging Setup for Datadog Integration: Switch Lambda Logs to Datadog Lambda Extension
column31:
Following a discussion with Imraaz, a change has been proposed to improve our current logging integration with Datadog. The recommendation is to modify how Lambda function logs are sent to Datadog to prevent log duplication and improve observability.

h3. Current Setup:

* All logs (including Lambda, VPC Flow Logs, API Gateway, MQ, etc.) are currently sent to Datadog using the Datadog forwarder Lambda.

h3. Proposed Change:

* Lambda function logs should be sent using the Datadog Lambda Extension instead of the forwarder.
* Other log groups (e.g., VPC flow logs, API Gateway logs, MQ logs) should continue using the Datadog forwarder.

h3. Reason for Change:

* Prevents log duplication that occurs when both forwarder and extension are used.
* Datadog Lambda Extension provides more detailed, performant, and reliable logging.

column1: State Restriction Errors Don't Appear on Owner Page
column31:
There is an error on the Sign + Submit page that indicates that the product is not available in the owner’s resident state. 

However, the error should be but is not present on the Owner page, which means the agent may complete the entire e-App to learn that the resident isn’t eligible for the application.



Also, I’m unclear what list of states the e-App is using - is this intended to be the “Launch States” list? I’ve seen this error in states that are available as Jurisdictions when you create an e-App; it seems to possibly relate to the Cross Border restrictions in some cases?

Required rules at launch are describe in the attachment[^Cross Border Form Trigger Question - Use Issue State or Signed At State.eml] .

column1: Create Monitoring and Alerting Solution for $1M Annual Aggregate Premium Limit in NC
column31:
We need to implement a compliance monitoring solution to ensure that Ceres does not exceed the $1M aggregate premium limit annually for fixed deferred annuities in North Carolina (NC).

Approach:

*  A Snowflake view is created to calculate the total premium for NC Fixed Deferred Annuity applications for the current calendar year.
*  The view excludes rejected/draft applications and only includes statuses like "Submitted" or "Approved".
*  A Snowflake Task is configured to run every 2 hours during business day, checking the NC premium total.
*  If total premium exceeds configurable thresholds (e.g., $850k, $950k, less than or equals to $1M), an automated email is sent to a designated distribution list. (Agent notification workflows)
*  A flag or query output (e.g., status field:  {{WARNING}}, {{BLOCK}}) is available to downstream systems such as the e-App platform for dynamic enforcement.

column1: Control on policy issued and policy premiums
column31:
The regulatory requirements is to account for each issued policy for actuarial and financial reporting. There is a blue print of the required control existing (Datadog) but it must be improved and tested for accuracy. So far it doesn’t work as expected.

 The requirement is to compare and reconcile the number of MYGA policies issued and each individual premium. 

# (A) Ops with IT should count issued policies with premium paid and save it daily. These are the issued policies from Ceres business perspective.
# (B ) After FAST daily cycle, (A) is compared with FAST outputs
# If A is not equal to B, then it triggers investigation. 

This should be automatic.

column1: SuranceBay Large File Handling
column31:
As SuranceBay uses out of the box integrations with FAST using the SOAP API, we have very little control over the payload. Due to this, there is an issue where large files can come over in the SOAP request payloads, much larger than the hard limits of the API gateway.

Due to this, we need the ability to have alternative networking infrastructure to allow API requests to go through the private link endpoints back to the FAST application servers hosting the SOAP API’s.

To enable this, we need to setup a cloudfront distribution pointing to the soap private link and possibly add verification of the API keys using cloudfront functions. This would require deploying the keys as an environment variable similar to how we do with the gateway as unfortunately cloudfront functions do not have the ability to reach out to AWS API’s to dynamically look them up.

column1: Task Report API - Task End Date defaulting to 1900-01-01 for completed task status
column31:
we observed that several tasks with a {{TASK_STATUS}} marked as *'Completed'* are still showing a {{TASK_END_DATE}} value of *1900-01-01 00:00:00.000*.

Ideally, this value should reflect the *latest modified timestamp* or the actual completion timestamp of the task.

*Example from data:*

* {{TASK_ID}}: a47890f0-4b79-434f-8559-6372c9d64e63
* {{TASK_STATUS}}: Completed
* {{TASK_END_DATE}}: 1900-01-01 00:00:00.000 (incorrect)
* Expected: A valid timestamp, preferably from {{MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP}}

*Request:*
Can we please update the pipeline logic or transformation to populate {{TASK_END_DATE}} appropriately—using {{MODIFIED_TIMESTAMP}} or a similar field—whenever the task status is marked as *Completed*?

column290: 12/Jun/25 9:10 AM;712020:e54cb698-f57e-4b9d-aa95-7e813bf8f556;Looking for a report that exists to utilize
column291: 13/Jun/25 9:18 AM;712020:e54cb698-f57e-4b9d-aa95-7e813bf8f556;Vishal to update with detail
column292:
13/Jun/25 11:26 AM;712020:cfa8765e-efc1-415e-93fd-458db9237bab;[~accountid:712020:e54cb698-f57e-4b9d-aa95-7e813bf8f556] [~accountid:712020:7d9448a6-787c-4e6b-80bf-100866d5d019] 

After our last meeting, one of the takeaways was to determine the best way to share daily interest amounts with the accounting team. We looked into it further and found a good approach using the FAST system.

FAST runs a nightly process called “Cash Value Quote” (CVQ), which calculates Cumulative Interest for each policy, along with other policy values. The CumInterest field seems like a good fit for what the accounting team needs — it builds up over time, so on day 1 you see one day’s worth of interest, day 2 shows two days, and so on.

We see two ways to get this information to the accounting team:

Option 1: *Use the existing report – PolicyFundLevelDetailReport*

* This report already runs daily. I’ve attached a sample of this file from last night’s INT Batch for reference.
* No extra work is needed from FAST.
* It includes all active policies in a single file, which keeps things simple.
* The system also generates a control file that contains count of records included in the main file. Attached the sample as well.

Option 2: *Set up a new event to publish CVQ data*

 

* Would require extra work to set up.
* One event would be created per policy.
* Events would be published during the nightly batch. As the number of policies grows, this could slow down the batch processing over time.

 

Option 1 is more straightforward and uses what we already have in place, so it could be the more efficient route. But we're happy to move forward with whichever option works best for your team.

column1: PROD Issue: FAST Lambda Not Pulling Files from Extracts S3 + GPG Signing Fails with Bad Passphrase
column31:
The nightly FAST batch (scheduled at 9:00 PM ET) is expected to pull files from FAST's outbound Extracts S3 bucket. Files are being pulled successfully in *QA*, but no files are being pulled in *PROD*.
Additionally, the *outbound Lambda function responsible for encrypting/signing* files before transfer is failing with a *"Bad passphrase"* error during GPG signing.

h3. *Findings & Details:*

* ✅ *Ankit's service that pushes rates files into FAST’s S3 is working correctly.*
* ❌ *In PROD*, files are not being pulled from FAST's outbound Extracts S3 bucket.
* 🔄 *Lambda job expected to run 30-minute interval checks for outbound files* may not be functioning in PROD.

h3. *Additional Issue (GPG Passphrase Error):*

When running the {{gpg_encrypt.sh}} script locally (and likely same in Lambda), the following error is observed:

*expand to see the error: getting this bad passphrase error.*

{{(darwinarm64) ~/Desktop  $ ~/workspace/local/bin/gpg_encrypt.sh ~/Desktop/ACH_FAST_ACH_20250605.txt ~/.ssh/ceres-jpmc-gpg.key ~/.ssh/ceres-gpg.key kzjPu67TDMsWgagTiZ3UYc4p3VoBMqP7e3gQGFibrRwUQGsohkGTKsfgtADd7996 [INFO] Using temporary GPG home: /var/folders/b0/dkjgtwkn6fl5jx556spxlt_m0000gn/T/tmp.dtfPOdfoAH [INFO] Importing recipient public key from: /Users/jaibapna/.ssh/ceres-jpmc-gpg.key gpg: keybox '/var/folders/b0/dkjgtwkn6fl5jx556spxlt_m0000gn/T/tmp.dtfPOdfoAH/pubring.kbx' created gpg: /var/folders/b0/dkjgtwkn6fl5jx556spxlt_m0000gn/T/tmp.dtfPOdfoAH/trustdb.gpg: trustdb created gpg: key 00C5A372CE421C82: public key "JPMC_GTI_MFT_FTS <IP_AIS_File_Transfer_Services_Ops@jpmchase.com>" imported gpg: Total number processed: 1 gpg:               imported: 1 [INFO] Importing signer private key from: /Users/jaibapna/.ssh/ceres-gpg.key gpg: key 659F90C3084CD7AA: public key "JPMC Incoming Prod (Encryption key used to decrypt extracts coming back to FAST from JPMC) <jpmc_incoming_prod@ceresinsurance.com>" imported gpg: key 659F90C3084CD7AA: secret key imported gpg: Total number processed: 1 gpg:               imported: 1 gpg:       secret keys read: 1 gpg:   secret keys imported: 1 [INFO] Using recipient key: 00C5A372CE421C82 [INFO] Using signer key:    659F90C3084CD7AA [INFO] Verifying passphrase for signer key... gpg: signing failed: Bad passphrase gpg: signing failed: Bad passphrase [ERROR] Invalid passphrase for signer key}}

Same issue is happening in the outbound file transfer lambda ,,

!Screenshot 2025-06-05 at 11.51.49 PM-20250606-070541.png|width=3402,height=1622,alt="Screenshot 2025-06-05 at 11.51.49 PM-20250606-070541.png"!

*Command to run:*

{noformat}(darwinarm64) ~/Desktop  $ ~/workspace/local/bin/gpg_encrypt.sh ~/Desktop/ACH_FAST_ACH_20250605.txt ~/.ssh/ceres-jpmc-gpg.key ~/.ssh/ceres-gpg.key kzjPu67TDMsWgagTiZ3UYc4p3VoBMqP7e3gQGFibrRwUQGsohkGTKsfgtADd7996{noformat}

*Script Used:*


*expand to see the script*

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail
h1. -------- CONFIGURABLE INPUTS --------
INPUT_FILE="$1"
OUTPUT_FILE="${INPUT_FILE}.encrypted"
PUBLIC_KEY_FILE="$2"      # .pgp
PRIVATE_KEY_FILE="$3"     # .asc
SIGNING_KEY_PASSPHRASE="$4"  # plaintext or env-var passed in
GPG_TEMP_HOME=$(mktemp -d)
h1. -------- FUNCTIONS --------
log()    { echo "[INFO] $_"; }_
_debug()  { echo "[DEBUG] $_" >&2; }
error()  { echo "[ERROR] $*" >&2; exit 1; }
cleanup() {
    rm -rf "$GPG_TEMP_HOME"
}
trap cleanup EXIT
h1. -------- STEP 1: IMPORT KEYS --------
log "Using temporary GPG home: $GPG_TEMP_HOME"
log "Importing recipient public key from: $PUBLIC_KEY_FILE"
gpg --homedir "$GPG_TEMP_HOME" --batch --import "$PUBLIC_KEY_FILE" || error "Failed to import public key"
log "Importing signer private key from: $PRIVATE_KEY_FILE"
gpg --homedir "$GPG_TEMP_HOME" --batch --yes --pinentry-mode loopback \
    --passphrase "$SIGNING_KEY_PASSPHRASE" \
    --import "$PRIVATE_KEY_FILE" || error "Failed to import private key"
h1. -------- STEP 2: Get Key IDs --------
RECIPIENT_KEY_ID=$(gpg --homedir "$GPG_TEMP_HOME" --list-keys --with-colons | awk -F: '/^pub/ {print $5; exit}')
SIGNER_KEY_ID=$(gpg --homedir "$GPG_TEMP_HOME" --list-secret-keys --with-colons | awk -F: '/^sec/ {print $5; exit}')
[[ -z "$RECIPIENT_KEY_ID" || -z "$SIGNER_KEY_ID" ]] && error "Missing key IDs after import"
log "Using recipient key: $RECIPIENT_KEY_ID"
log "Using signer key:    $SIGNER_KEY_ID"
h1. -------- STEP 3: Verify Passphrase Works --------
log "Verifying passphrase for signer key..."
echo "test" > "$GPG_TEMP_HOME/dummy.txt"
gpg --homedir "$GPG_TEMP_HOME" --batch --yes --pinentry-mode loopback \
    --passphrase "$SIGNING_KEY_PASSPHRASE" \
    --local-user "$SIGNER_KEY_ID" \
    --output "$GPG_TEMP_HOME/dummy.sig" \
    --sign "$GPG_TEMP_HOME/dummy.txt" || error "Invalid passphrase for signer key"
log "Passphrase verification successful."
h1. -------- STEP 4: Encrypt and Sign --------
log "Encrypting and signing file: $INPUT_FILE"
gpg --homedir "$GPG_TEMP_HOME" --no-tty --yes --batch \
    --pinentry-mode loopback --passphrase "$SIGNING_KEY_PASSPHRASE" \
    --trust-model always \
    --recipient "$RECIPIENT_KEY_ID" \
    --local-user "$SIGNER_KEY_ID" \
    --encrypt --sign \
    --output "$OUTPUT_FILE" "$INPUT_FILE" || error "GPG sign+encrypt failed"
log "Success: File encrypted and signed at $OUTPUT_FILE"

h3. *Impacted Components:*

* {{FAST outbound S3}} (PROD)
* {{Outbound file transfer Lambda job}} (likely disabled or malfunctioning)
* {{GPG file signing}} (passphrase failure)

h3. *Action Items:*

# ✅ *Check if Lambda job is running in PROD* to pull from FAST’s outbound Extracts S3 bucket every 30 minutes.
#* Confirm function is deployed and enabled.
#* Validate CloudWatch logs and S3 file listings.
# 🔐 *Investigate passphrase issue for signer GPG key.*
#* Confirm the passphrase being used is correct.
#* Check if Lambda environment variable for the passphrase is missing, misconfigured, or changed.
#* Test decrypting the key manually with the same passphrase.
# 🧪 *Validate outbound Lambda file transfer job to JPMC and Oracle*
#* Confirm that encrypted files are correctly generated and transferred.
#* Ensure the batch flow from S3 → Lambda → Encryption → Transfer is working E2E.
# 📌 *High Urgency*
#* This is blocking nightly file delivery.
#* Lambda job and encryption signing need immediate triage.

[^AgentPayments_EFT_20250605.txt]
[^ACH_FAST_ACH_20250605.txt]
[^Disbursements_EFT_20250605.txt]

column1: Surrendering Plan Type Should Be But Is Not Required
column31:
Surrendering Plan Type should be but is not always required.

Both Surrendering Plan Type [https://3clife.atlassian.net/browse/CL-1031|https://3clife.atlassian.net/browse/CL-1031|smart-link] and Surrendering Plan Type fields are required for the ACORD form - they should be, but are not, required for _all_ e-Apps and funding payments that are replacements.

(I believe the fields were required in the past but they aren’t today in UAT - I tested in QA and UAT - Product Type is required in QA for NQ but not qualified plan types but not UAT; Plan Type is required in neither)

column1: Display "Same as Owner" "Same as Joint Owner" on Application & ACORD Forms
column31:
When the App PDF is rendered and the Annuitant or Joint Annuitant is the same as the Owner or Joint Owner, there is no information printed on the Application or ACORD forms.

When the Annuitant or Joint Annuitant is the Owner or _Joint_ Owner, the user indicates this on the Annuitant Role or Joint Annuitant Role page.

Unfortunately, because there is no information printed and the App and ACORD forms say “Complete only if different from owner,” the Annuitant is mis-represented as the Owner rather than the Joint Owner. Worse, if the Joint Owner is also the Joint Annuitant, there is no reference at all to there being a Joint Annuitant.

Options to solve this - for discussion to decide which approach is fastest to implement on e-App.

# {color:#ff5630}Display “Same as Owner” or “Same as Joint Owner” in the application Relationship to Owner field (blue below), and in the name field on the ACORD form. (EF: We are going with this option){color}
# Repeat / copy the Owner and Joint Owner demographic/address information in the Annuitant section and Joint Annuitant section (as applicable to the specific e-App).

 

NOTE: This does *NOT* change the UI nor does it change the 103 mapping. This is ONLY on the Application form and ACORD form.

!image-20250520-164512.png|width=781,height=701,alt="image-20250520-164512.png"!

!image-20250520-164442.png|width=746,height=308,alt="image-20250520-164442.png"!

Do I have that right?

column1: Replacement form misinformation in DocuSign
column31:
# From suitability replacement screen, the "are you replacing an annuity" question is selected 'no', but the 'Replacement of life insurance or annuities' form is populated in DocuSign with both of the replacement questions answered as 'yes' when they should be 'no'. Technically, this form should not populate if there is no replacement.

# The replacement form in DocuSign auto populates the ‘INSURED OR ANNUITANT’ and ‘REPLACED (R) OR FINANCING (F) fields when there is no corresponding policy or contract being replaced. These fields should only populate if there is information in the ‘INSURER NAME’ and 'CONTRACT OR POLICY #’ fields.

Replacement Form generating when replacement question is answered ‘no’ (1):

 If issue related to iLife eApp:  
Policy Number: M000004866 
Application ID: 1BD79PUFHBG0  
Expected Behavior:   When the replacement question is answered 'no', there should be no replacement form in DocuSign or attached to the case.

Fields on the replacement form populating when there is no corresponding contract or policy being replaced (2):

 If issue related to iLife eApp:  
Policy Number: M000004876 
Application ID: LKQ9DKL76SQY  
Expected Behavior:   If the ‘INSURER NAME’ and ‘CONTRACT OR POLICY #’ fields are both blank, the corresponding ‘INSURED OR ANNUITANT’ and 'REPLACED (R) OR FINANCING (F) fields should be blank.

column1: Application Name change on App Dashboard
column31:
Allow the agent/user to create a Name for the application which is displayed on the Application list/dashboard to allow them to find their e-Apps quickly. When an e-App is created, default to a string then allow the user to change it within the e-App. Suggested string: 1st few (8?) characters of the Owner’s Last/Full name - Product Name abbreviation - Plan Type - Jurisdiction. For example, “Gadue-MYGA3Yr-TradIRA-CT” or “Brito Tr-FIA7Yr-NQ-FL” (i.e. Owner’s name begins “Brito Trust…”).

Alternately, but less user friendly, add Plan Type as a column.

column1: Clone e-App: Policy Number Assignment Tied to Agent Search/Can Sell
column31:
To generate a Policy Number after cloning an application and clicking through to the Product page, either force a CanSell check for the prepopulated writing code of the Primary Writing Agent or prompt the user to execute a CanSell check.

If forcing CanSell is complex or problematic--which Pramod has indicated it is--then we will accept clearing prefilled primary and split-allocation agent information as a way to prompt the user to enter a writing code and trigger a CanSell check.

!image-20250612-171955.png|width=1493,height=1192,alt="image-20250612-171955.png"!

!image-20250612-172048.png|width=1482,height=1191,alt="image-20250612-172048.png"!
column290:
12/Jun/25 1:13 PM;712020:e4b6730b-987d-4f20-8ae5-ca1281ea0d8e;Archiving original ticket description from Lynn:

{quote}The clone function is working well now (!!!) but it’s not intuitive that you need to tab off of the Primary Writing Agent’s Writing Code to re-trigger the Policy Number assignment (and Can Sell and Agent Search).

When a cloned e-App is created and accessed from the Dashboard:

a.) The policy number needs to be assigned - DESIGN FOR DISCUSSION - options: automatically call it when a cloned e-App is accessed for the first time, or add a “Assign Policy Number” button on the Product page and add an error on the Product page if there is no # assigned, (other options?).

b.) Agent Search/Can Sell - automatically call both APIs when ANY application is accessed from the Application list/dashboard and/or when the Sign + Submit page is accessed. This may be current functionality but it hasn’t been tested.{quote}

column1: GIACT Banking Error - 2 ACH Pymts, Same Routing/Account # - 1 Errors and the Other Doesn't
column31:
I have 2 ACH payments on an e-App with the same Bank Routing Number and Bank Account Number - different Account Owner Name, amounts - and one errors with a message “The Bank Routing Number and/or Account Number may be invalid, please verify that the information was entered correctly” but the other doesn't. I copied & pasted from the “good” one to the one that errors.

If there is a real error on the payment, the message must be wrong. We did +not+ request an error indicating that the same account cannot be used twice, nor am I aware that it’s checking the account owner (if it was both should fail).

column1: Display GIACT Error on ACH Page
column31:
If there is a GIACT error on an ACH payment, the error text is displayed only on the Funding Summary. If it s not displayed on the ACH Payment when you edit it. 

It would be a much better user experience if the error was displayed on the ACH page, and if you could verify the banking information on the ACH page. I suggest leaving the current validation in place (i.e. when you click Proceed) and, in addition: display the GIACT error on the ACH page if the user edits the ACH payment and adding a “Verify” button on the ACH page similar to the method implemented on the Owner page to verify GIACT identity.

column1: Funding > ACH - Fields are not Displayed in Correct Order
column31:
If you return to the ACH page (such as to fix the banking info if there is a GIACT error), the fields are displayed in an illogical order and therefore it’s hard to use this page.

!image-20250604-142226.png|width=507,height=255,alt="image-20250604-142226.png"!

This is the order that is displayed when adding a new ACH payment - the fields should be in this order when editing an ACH payment:

column1: Add "Explanation" Field to support a revised Customer Identity Verification Form
column31:
Kyle (Ceres Compliance) would like to add a field asking the agent to explain why they were unable to review the ID documents of their customer. Impacts:

* A revision to the form is forthcoming to include this field - it will need to be replaced in e-App and tagged for the new field 
* Add a new text field to the UI on that Additional Information page that displays underneath the “I was unable to personally review” checkbox (see yellow in the attached screenshot) if that checkbox is checked. It should not display if the “I certify that I personally met” checkbox is checked. This field is required; this the text associated with the field:
** “Please explain why you were unable to review the Owner and (if applicable) Joint Owner’s identification documents. NOTE: Failure to personally review the identification documents will result in processing delays in order to verify customer identity and may result in a decision not to accept the business.” 
* Support this new field, and print the agent’s full name under the signature, on the revised form.
* Research if this can be added into the FAST 103. If so: 
** Include both the checkbox and the explanation fields in the 103 so we can trigger the associated manual processing.
** If this information cannot be added into the FAST 103, I suggest adding it to the Internal Application Summary Form.

column1: Revert e-App to Data Entry Phase to Apply Corrections/Changes or re-trigger the Email
column31:
The only way to revert an e-App back to the Data Entry phase is to Decline to sign the e-App.

Once a signer has accepted the Terms & Conditions the first time using DocuSign, their acknowledgement is “remembered” so if they access DocuSign again to continue signatures on the same or begin signatures on a new e-App they do not have the Option to decline.

Therefore, there is no way to revert the e-App back to the Data Entry phase.

Agents will have occasions to need to revert an e-App back - such as to change from In Person to Remote signatures (or vice versa), or to apply a change a signer found when reviewing the documents (spelling errors, amount corrections, changes to other information).
column290: 09/Jun/25 11:08 AM;712020:0f7b90fd-586f-48f3-8ef5-ca33b8674e17;[~accountid:712020:0f7b90fd-586f-48f3-8ef5-ca33b8674e17] [~accountid:712020:758c8512-1a14-4138-a9e7-e72824eae12a] [~accountid:712020:9c883918-ba50-4706-81a4-356964308094] [~accountid:712020:2e56e751-bc61-4568-8518-02d94e19bfda] [~accountid:712020:e4b6730b-987d-4f20-8ae5-ca1281ea0d8e] : need to understand whether there is a way to revert back the signatures once it moves to Docusign. What we heard from iLife is that if there is a decline there, it reverts back. However, the scenario above indicates otherwise.

column1: Funding: Total Expected Initial Premium Display Cents
column31:
The UI should always display/save dollars and cents in the Total Expected Initial Premium field.

Currently, cents are only displayed/saved if the user types them. If the user enters a whole dollar, then that is what is stored and printed on forms (and I assume sent to FAST?).

For consistency and precision, if the user does not enter “cents” when entering a dollar amount in the Total Expected Initial Premium, or the amount on any of the variations of the “Add Funding” page, then the system should default to .00 (i.e. if I enter 125000 then it defaults/formats it to $125,000.00).

column1: adding dashboard to display policeis without agent info
Forms Matrix Rules Not Functioning - Visibility (Row 14)
column31:
The rules which are present in the requirements spreadsheet, FormsMatrix tab, row 14 “Visible to these roles in DocuSign” are not functioning.

Currently, every signer can see every form rather than the forms as required on that tab. 

The Forms Matrix indicates which role(s) should see the form (row 14) in addition to who should sign the form (row 13). Generally (with exceptions - such as the Addtl Bene Form) only the signer of the form should see the form. For example, the Annuitant should not view the ACH form unless they are also the Owner or Joint Owner or bank account holder; the Suitability Form should be displayed to only signers: the Owner (or their POA, Guardian or Trustee), Joint Owner (or their POA or Guardian), and the Primary Writing Agent.



This requirement addresses compliance concerns, which is intended to protect PII and confidential information such as SSNs, bank account numbers, account numbers of policies being replaced, signatures and the confidential information on the Suitability Form (net worth, debt, etc.).

column1: Completed/Signed Forms (with PII) are Emailed to Signers - Not Secure/Encrypted
column31:
After all signer have signed an e-App (in person or remotely), each role is sent an UNSECURED email with an attachment for document they signed.

There is PII included in these documents - we should consider whether we should terminate the send of this information or to encrypt it in some way (how would they get access?), or direct the signer to the Customer Portal to download them (if they’re the Owner) or obtain them from their agent or Ceres customer service.

Assigning this a High status since it’s a compliance/regulatory concern that I’ve not heard has been addressed yet (hopefully it has been and this is a duplicate?).

column1: Include plan type in the Suitability API request
column31:
Revising this ticket to reflect alternative solution identified with Infras and FAST at the Jun 12 3pm call. Rather than make the questions required, pass the plan type to FAST so that FAST can adjust the scoring rubric as needed.

*Original Ticket Solution:*

_Make two Suitability questions required in the eApp_ 

_There are two questions that are currently marked as optional per requirements, but recently they got added to the Suitability scoring calculation in FAST._ 

_These two questions need to be marked as required to prevent confusion and blockers from retrieving a suitability score._
column290:

The appropriate approach is to fix the Suitability calculation or to add “not applicable” as an option to both questions.

column1: Replacement Notice - Remove "White Space"
column31:
The original discussions & requirements around this form indicate that replacements should be listed on this form without “missing teeth” or gaps. Currently, the right payments are listed but they’re ordered by payment number. 

In this example, rows 1 and 4 shouldn’t be there, and the 3 that are there should be 1, 2 and 3. 

We will NOT control this on the UI; agents will add payments in any order they like, this needs to be fixed for the form. Also, the Annuitant’s name should be printed only if there is other payment information.

column1: Change Type of Ownership Doesn't Correct Reflexive Pages/Fields
column31:
If you create an e-App with one Type of Ownership (TOC), then click to the Owner page and Save it. If you return to the Product page to change the Type of Ownership, the e-App doesn’t correct the subsequent Applicant Information pages.

For example, if you pick TOC = Joint, advance to the Owner page, complete that, then click Proceed - then realize you didn’t need a Joint Owner - and return to the Product page to change the TOC to Natural Person and Save or Proceed, the Joint Owner page isn’t removed including after clicking Proceed on the Owner page. When you click Proceed, the e-App won’t advance but there are no errors.

I’ve also seen errors with changing to/from Trust and to/from Entity.

column1: Day 2: e-App Forms Corrections/Replacement
column31:
Forms should be available prior to signatures for display and/or wet signatures using View PDF on the dashboard Application summary page. When an e-App goes to signature, the then current forms should be presented for signature if a form is replaced in the environment, if form configuration changed, etc. between the time the form is started / the form is triggered and the signature process is started.

* Confirm with iLife that “then current” forms are always applicable to an e-App prior to the signature phase if changes are deployed to the environment after the e-App is started and before signatures are started.
** If this is not the case, change this Jira to a defect as that has been the required functionality
** If this is the expected functionality now, test and confirm this functionality is working correctly.



For example,

# A field on the form is not tagged or is tagged incorrectly, and a correction is deployed to production 
## The new configuration should be used after the e-App is created but before signatures are started.
## The old configuration is used once signatures are started
# An entire form is revised; for example, Rev 10/24 is replaced with one Rev 6/25 after e-App is started but before signatures begin.
## The new configuration should be used after the e-App is created but before signatures are started.
## The old configuration is used once signatures are started

We need to understand how iLife manages when we change to a new form version. This will happen over time

column1: Post issue workflow queues and Tasks
PROD_DEPLOYMENT - DAY 1: Snowflake Pipeline & Reporting Rollout
column31:
This ticket tracks the production deployment of the Snowflake pipeline and BI reporting. The scope includes:

* Activation of event ingestion from FAST to Snowflake via AWS Kafka.
* Validation of data flow across Raw, Harmonized, and Consumption layers.
* Deployment of all Snowflake database objects (tables, views, tasks, procedures).
* Finalization and deployment of Task Report API setup with date and report ID parameters.
* Snowflake-to-Power BI connectivity and publishing to PROD workspace.
* Setup Schedulers for Events, extract file, API.

[^Production_Deployment_Checklist.xlsx]

column1: Can Sell Error: No Appointment Error
column31:
There should be a Can Sell appointment error if the Jurisdiction is a pre-appointment state (PA, UT, IN) and the agent does not have an ACTIVE appointment.

If the Can Sell response is FALSE and the Jurisdiction is one of these 3 states, the appointment error should be displayed and prevent signature. If FALSE and another state, then no error is expected.



Today I tested with Ind000945 (who has an expired PA appointment) and did not receive the error. Not sure if the agent data will look the same when this is corrected. 

Also, if you test with an agent that does not have a PA appointment at all, the error is not produced. See Ind000900.

column1: Can Sell: AML, Product Training, E&O Questions Displayed When NOT Expected
column31:
In UAT I am receiving the AML and Product Training and E&O Questions on the Product page based on API response incorrectly. I’ve looked in FAST INT1 and compared results - not sure if there is an API problem or not.

* The Product Training question is displaying for all agents I’ve tried including those that have Product Training in FAST with a Completion Date in the past.
* The E&O question is displaying for all agents including those that have active E&O (“today” is after the Start Date and before the Expiry Date in FAST).
* The AML question is not always displaying but it is usual. The Start/Expiry Dates in FAST don’t seem to influence the results.



The Product Training question/conditional text should display only if there is no product training in FAST or if the Completion Date is after the current date (which should never happen). Those conditions should produce a “FALSE” in the related Can Sell response.

Likewise, the E&O conditional text should display if the Can Sell response if FALSE given the agent’s Writing Code and today’s date, which should occur only when the current date is not on or between the E&O Start and Expiry Dates.

Likewise, the AML conditional text should display only if the current date is not on or between the AML Start and Expiry Dates (FALSE in Can Sell Response).



Today I used these agents (not sure if they’ll still look the same when this is fixed): 

CLI000001 should have no AML, Prod Train, E&O errors

CLI000005 should have only E&O question.

Ind000945 should have all 3 questions.

Ind000932 should have the Prod Train question only.

column1: Maturity Date Calculation
column31:
*Maturity Date*: The date is based on the Owner’s date of birth or, in the case of Joint Owners, the older Owner’s date of birth. If the Contract is owned by a non-natural person, the date is based on the Annuitant’s date of birth.  If the Contract is owned by a non-natural person and has Joint Annuitants, the Maturity Date is based on the older Annuitant’s date of birth. The Maturity Date is the date upon which Annuity Payments must begin or the Contract must be surrendered.

 

Example:

* FAST populate in yellow
* Expected in green

 

|*OwnerDOB*|*OwnerIssueAge*|*OwnerGender*|*PolicyNumber*|*Product*|*PlanID*|*PolicyStatus*|*IssueDate*|*MaturityDate*|*TerminationDate*|*IssueState*|*AnnuitantGender*|*AnnuitantDOB*|
|1970-07-18|54|Female|M000003540|MADISON_MYGA| |Active|5/22/25|2071-05-22|2071-05-22|OK| | |
|1970-07-18|54|Female|M000003540|MADISON_MYGA|0|Active|5/22/25|2102-05-22|2102-05-22|OK|Male|2001-08-05|
|-|-|-|M000003540|-|-|-|-|FALSE|FALSE|-| | |

column1: Adding OTP Agent log in automation to e2e suite
Design/Build System Notification or rules for North Carolina $1M aggregate limit per year
column31:
We have a potential compliance issues if we exceed the 41M aggregate limit annually for North Carolina. 

$1m could be hit within a few days given that the average applied for premium for a fixed deferred annuity is ~ $180k - $120k (see link below).

 In addition to field communication and impacts to other systems like illustrations, we’d need to **immediately** remove it from availability when you create an e-App AND also inform agents with e-Apps that haven’t been submitted that they’ll be rejected if they are submitted. I searched for “aggregate” in Jira didn’t find anything tracked this issue – hopefully it’s already been handled? If not, we may like to create a Jira so that isn’t lost.



[https://www.thinkadvisor.com/2025/02/25/wave-of-fixed-rate-annuity-maturities-looms-morgan-stanley-analysts-say/|https://www.thinkadvisor.com/2025/02/25/wave-of-fixed-rate-annuity-maturities-looms-morgan-stanley-analysts-say/|smart-link]

column1: Indirect Rollover Processing for FAST
column31:
Here’s a summary of the changes required on the FAST side. These updates are relatively minor and should not take long to implement. That said, I still need to confirm with the actuary to ensure this approach aligns with our business and product rules.

 

*Scenario:*

*If an application includes an Indirect Rollover with ACH*, will FAST receive the banking information in the <FinancialActivity> block of the ACORD 103 XML?

* *If yes:* FAST already has logic in place that utilizes the MoneyTransferType field to set the appropriate PremiumType:
** "6" = Regular Payment
** "7" = Indirect Rollover
* If no, we’ll need to determine how this information is sent, and map accordingly.

 

*Required Changes on FAST:*

* Update the *UI* to support and display additional payment types on the NB Application screen (beyond just Regular Payment).
* Ensure the *suspense record is populated accurately* based on the value of NBPayments.PaymentType, which is derived from MoneyTransferType. Note: The system automatically creates a suspense record upon case issue.

 

*FAST Assumptions:*

* iLife will include the MoneyTransferType field under the <FinancialActivity> block in the ACORD 103 XML. I’ve attached a sample xml that I manually mocked up to include MoneyTransferType field.
* Valid values:
** "6" for Regular Payments
** "7" for Indirect Rollovers
* If this field is not provided, FAST will *default PremiumType to "Regular Payment"*.

 

*Questions:*

# *If there is an Indirect Rollover with ACH, should a replacement block also be sent to FAST?*
#* This won’t impact the implementation effort but may have implications for operations, as replacements typically generate additional requirements/tasks in FAST.
# *Are there any other scenarios—besides Indirect Rollovers—that could result in ACH transactions not classified as New Money?*

 

Please review and let me know if you have any feedback or additional scenarios to consider. I’ll follow up with confirmation from the actuarial team as soon as I have it. Vishal

column1: Indirect Rollover Processing Changes
column31:
* *Indirect Rollover Issue:* Nerone and Sarah discussed an issue with indirect rollovers, where the current configuration causing problems. 
* For an indirect rollover, or when funds are applied. What's happening: it's kicking it out back to the client because the system is treating it as a contributions over the $8000 qualified contribution. It needs to treat as a rollover. 
* Glenn said: indirect rollover should accommodate the tax qualification appropriately and not treat it as a qualified contribution.
* *Compliance and Options:* Sarah discussed the compliance aspects and options for addressing the issue. She mentioned that we should be responsible for processing the payment and sending the approriate tax forms at the end of the year.
* *eApp Implications/Solutions:* 
** Step 1: Glenn suggested putting a disclaimer in the E app and removing the orchestration check for contribution limits. iLife will pass over indirect rollover without triggering a 951 as a qualifed contribution.
** Step 2: Niko agreed that this could be the first step, followed by addressing the mapping issue to ensure FAST recognizes the indirect rollover correctly.
* *Fast Implications/Solutions:* 
** Fast needs to account for the payment type. 
** We need Fast to accept that value from the 103. Even if it's a indirect rollover, they don't have EFT, so that needs to get added.

column1: TTEE Expected on Trustee Signature and Printed Name
column31:
When a Trustee signs on behalf of a Trust, “TTEE” or “Trustee” is expected to be concatenated next to the name of the Trustee on all forms (_except the Trust form_, which indicates that person is a Trustee on the signature line and because they are signed on their own behalf).

This applies to the information sent to DocuSign, in addition to the Printed Name on the application. For example, Lynn Gadue, TTEE (not Lynn Gadue           , TTEE). This applies to all 10 signers.



This is similar to [https://3clife.atlassian.net/browse/CL-1015|https://3clife.atlassian.net/browse/CL-1015|smart-link] - except for the comment related to the Trust Form. Every form the POA or Guardian signs should have that designated next to it as opposed to the Trustees signing the Trust Form.

column1: Trust Mailing Address
column31:
If the application is a Trust (Type of Ownership = Trust), if the user selects an address from the Google Address results and selects the address using the mouse or the keyboard, all fields from the address are parsed into the Street Line 1, City and Zip Code.

The State is not copied to the State field.

It’s working on other pages like Owner (person).



This can be fixed post-launch.

column1: "POA" is not printed with the POA's name in the Printed Name field nor is it Sent to DocuSign
column31:
When a Power of Attorney signs on behalf of the Owner (or Joint Owner, Annuitant, Joint Annuitant), the e-App should affix “, POA” after the POA’s name on the Printed Name (i.e. contatenated with it - for example Lynn Marie Gadue, POA or Sue Wu, POA) and in the integration to start the DocuSign process (email and signing activity).

While the signer can control their Signature (they can add “, POA” next to their name for the signature), they cannot control the Printed Name.

We’ve discussed with iLife that the name should be concatenated with the signer’s name so there isn’t a lot of blank space. For example, Lynn Marie Gadue, POA not Lynn Marie Gadue                  , Trustee.

Likewise, if the signer is a Guardian, “, Guardian” should be printed with the name and sent to DocuSign. I expect it’s not given POA isn't.



The preferred solution for signatures overall is to use the Full Name associated with the Signature in DocuSign so it exactly matches the signature rather than adding it by e-App before the forms are sent to DocuSign. However, if this not possible then this Jira is even more important.



This is a defect, not a change request. It’s been discussed since last year and has been documented as a requirement in the business requirements spreadsheet.

column1: Incorrect Party Signs when Owner has a POA/Guardian
column31:
If the Owner has a POA or Guardian and the Owner is indicated to sign remotely, the email should be sent to the POA or Guardian not the Owner. The email is being sent to the Owner and the Owner’s name is being rendered on the form as the Printed Name and as the name in DocuSign. While you can change the name associated with the signature, DocuSign doesn’t control the Printed Name. 



I assume the same problem exists for the other roles that allow POA/Guardian - Joint Owner, Annuitant, Joint Annuitant.



If this cannot be corrected in time for launch, I suggest we consider removing the ability to specify a POA or Guardian since the Printed Name is not represented correctly.



POA name is mine; Owner’s email is my Ceres email, POA email is my SPARK email.

!image-20250522-205549.png|width=982,height=788,alt="image-20250522-205549.png"!

Email was sent to my Ceres email and the POA’s name was not mentioned in the email.

!image-20250522-205742.png|width=1262,height=1504,alt="image-20250522-205742.png"!

!image-20250522-205804.png|width=1340,height=922,alt="image-20250522-205804.png"!

You can change the Full Name and therefore the signature:

!image-20250522-205838.png|width=1248,height=1092,alt="image-20250522-205838.png"!



But it does not change the Printed Name on the form

!image-20250522-205900.png|width=1368,height=580,alt="image-20250522-205900.png"!

column1: Cross Border Rule is Misstated/Incorrect on Sign + Submit
column31:
This error message appears to be incorrect on the Sign and Submit page: “The selected product is not available for sale in the owner’s state.”

This error appears on the Sign + Submit page only; it’s expected on the Owner page but is not present - see also [https://3clife.atlassian.net/browse/CL-1007|https://3clife.atlassian.net/browse/CL-1007|smart-link]  Therefore, this is the 1st time the user will see the error.



This error appears to be related to one of the Cross Border rules where, if the Jurisdiction is equal to AR, MA, MS, UT, WA or WI, then the Owner’s Residence State must be the same as the Jurisdiction. iLife will need to confirm the trigger for this message but if it is, this is NOT the same. If that is the trigger for this rule (??), the error message is incorrect; it should be “In <state name> the Jurisdiction and Owner’s Residence State / Governing State / State of Incorporation must be the same.”

In this example, the Jurisdiction is AR and the Owner’s Residence State is FL. The only warning on the Owner page relates GIACT identity verification so I assume that is the trigger for this rule.

column1: Florida Agent Appointments: Research Options to Determine County
column31:
Research what options we have to determine the County associated with a Florida application to support the agent appointment workflow. There is a table that correlates Zip Code to one of the 67 counties in Florida.

Here are several ideas but there may be others:

# County is not needed for all or some FL e-Apps for appointments
## We’ll appoint all agents with a Resident license in FL and/or that sell in Florida to “all” counties.
## If we’re considering not assigning County to all FL e-Apps then confirm *before* finalizing the decision if County is needed in any FL periodic state regulatory / compliance reporting.   
# By NIPR
## I think we must derive and send the County in the appointment request, but NIPR may now have a function where we send the Zip and they derive the County.
# In e-App ^
## After the Owner Residence* Address is selected OR CHANGED on the Owner page, using the existing Google Address search API or another API. Consider users that use the Google search function and those that manually enter it without automated assistance.
## The field is manually entered by the user/agent and is not validated in e-App.
# In FAST (talk to Rich)
## Electronically when the e-App is imported into FAST
## Automatically through a process that is run after the e-App is imported and [before or when] the appointment request is sent to NIPR.
## Manually after import and before the appointment is requested.



^ FL is a pre-appointment state so the County isn’t needed in the “Can Sell” request/process. It’s needed in FAST though to ensure the right appointment is active before policy issue.

* Note: Jira xxx will determine which address to use when the Owner is an entity or trust.

!image-20250522-165823.png|width=576,height=383,alt="image-20250522-165823.png"!



Assigning to parent eApp but this isn’t an e-App-only research item. Feel free to change if appropriate.

column1: Florida County for Owner
column31:
In the state of Florida, appointments are requested by County (or “all” can also be applied for but it's expensive).

Ask Erik, Kyle and Ashley to discuss and confirm which address is used in the State of Florida if the Owner is an Entity, and if the Owner is a Trust. For example, use the mailing address for the entity, or use the Annuitant’s address. Note: we do not collect any information about who the Grantor(s) is/are. 

This information is needed in multiple system - possibly e-App, certainly FAST (NIPR integration) and possibly SuranceBay - and for Customer Service scripts, training, etc. and Operations/Producer Guides. Assigning to e-App parent for now but feel free to change if appropriate.

column1: Florida Specific Tasks
Agent Portal Prod DNS Name on Root Domain
Cross Border Restrictions & UI Rule/Message Display
column31:
*Display the following rules/messages on the Product page and Owner page*

The Cross Border rule address in AN_MG_28 on the Product page is displayed, but not on the Owner page.

* NO cross-border sales if the +owner+ resides in states listed below: 
** Cross Border Restricted States are: Arkansas, California, Idaho, Maine, Massachusetts, Minnesota, Mississippi, New York, Utah, Washington, Wisconsin
** -If the Jurisdiction is listed, then the Owner’s Residence (or Governing, or Incorporation) State must be the same as the Jurisdiction.- Rule to enforce:  If the Owner’s Residence / Governing / Incorporated State is in the list, it must be the same as the Jurisdiction. 
*** The rules and messages were documented in January - see AN_MG_54, AN_MG_82 and AN_MG_112
*** LMG: June 11, 25: Removed the 1st part of this rule but the other is still required - used strikeout in the bullet above, and adjusted the AN_MG items above using grey font.[^Cross Border Form Trigger Question - Use Issue State or Signed At State.eml] 
* Cross border sales are allowed if the owner is not a resident of the above states, and:
** The product is available in BOTH the owner resident and owner application sign state, and
** A cross-border sales form (in eApp) is completed.

!image-20250523-180305.png|width=789,height=285,alt="image-20250523-180305.png"!

Discuss with legal whether we will restrict Owner and Joint Owner Signed At State based on decided cross border rules. LMG 6/11/25: we will NOT - see attached email.

column292:
23/May/25 2:28 PM;712020:d3dafcee-764b-4ca2-8f83-aa0e5e0b8c72;From Lynn:

At launch display state requirements as early as possible in the process so the agent doesn’t get confused on our state availability or too far into the process before finding the e-App cannot be submitted at this time.

These rules were added to the Business Requirements doc in March but were not configured - they are not currently working for any states (including CA, NY or other states which are not in the Jurisdiction list).

* Product Page
** AN_MG_536: Always display informational text (since the list of approved states is smaller than the list of unapproved states):
*** *The Owner must reside (or, if an entity, must be incorporated or governed) in, and the application must be signed in, one of these states:  (list of Ceres+MYGA approved states).*
*** Development note: this is in addition to, not instead of, the “cross border rules” state (AN_MG_28) which considers Jurisdiction and Owner Residence State but not Owner Signed At State.
* Owner Page (all: person, trust and entity)
** If the Owner’s Residence State, or the Owner’s Governing State, or the Owner’s State of Incorporation is not an approved state: 
*** *The Owner must reside (or, if an entity, may not be incorporated or governed) in one of these states: (same list of states as above).*
*** For example, assuming CT is an approved state: if the Jurisdiction is CT, the Owner may not reside in NY.
* I will add a different Jira for Owner’s Signed At State.

Other Notes:

* These rules derive from my understanding of direction received from Joe B originally and Erik more recently. Specifically, we need to edit to ensure the Issue State, Owner Residence State and Owner Signed At State is a state where [the legal entity Ceres Life is licensed and the MYGA is approved in the state for sale by Ceres].
* This item was in the e-App Open Items log dating back to March but I can’t find a Jira for it. These requirements have also been shared with Amanda by email and Slack a few times.

column1: Agent Welcome Letter
Signature Process - Expect Delays
column31:
Add or update informational text on the Sign + Submit page (perhaps display under or near “Complete Signature” after the user clicks “Complete Signature”?) to inform the user that:

# It may take ?a minute? after clicking “Complete Signature” to see the links to sign documents and/or to receive the email to sign. 
## I’ve found it takes quite a while longer than expected (even in UAT - it’s far from instantaneous).
### At first I was wondering if the system was “stuck” - I couldn’t tell that it was doing anything. There is a “Ready for Signature” temporary message that displays in the upper right but only AFTER you can access the links not before.
## See screenshot below.
## Also consider whether we can display some type of “Processing…” image or text so the user doesn’t think the system froze or isn’t working.
# The “Sign here” does not change to “View here” after you finish an “in person” DocuSign signing ceremony until you refresh the page using your browser refresh, exit the e-App or go to another page and return to Sign + Submit.

column31:
The left nav circle should be red when the user answers “No” to any one of the “can sell” questions related to AML training, product training and E&O. However, it is green.



This is low priority for launch at this time because all 3 errors are displayed correctly (!!!!) on the Sign and Submit page (although unfortunately the message doesn’t indicate which page to return to if a change is appropriate) and the “Complete Signature” button is disabled if any are “No” and is enabled when all 3 are “Yes.”

column1: Suitability Message is Red & Displayed on Funding > ACH Payment page
column31:
Entered Applicant Info, Bene, Funding and Suitability info… then returned to the *Funding* summary page and saw the suitability message on the ACH page. See screenshot. Not sure why there is a Suitability message on a non-Suitability page.

That is confusing and incorrect but not a critical problem.

However, the error is in red and the Funding circle went yellow. Users will / should associate with red errors with no signature allowed.

If I went forward then back to Funding, the error went away then the left nav circle went green again… I don’t understand enough about what is happening on this page to know if this is a “one off” or a more notable problem. Will continue to test and comment if I see this persistently.

I suggest improve the text and add information to warn the agent that running the pre-assessment is required before they may begin the signature phase, and to more clearly explain that the Suitability information “locks” after it’s run the 3rd.



Suggested: 

*You must run the Suitability Pre-Assessment at least once before you Complete Signatures on the Sign + Submit page.* 

*The Suitability Pre-Assessment may be run up to 3 times. After the Pre-Assessment runs the third time you may not change information on the Suitability pages.*

column1: Select Account Owner DDLB Options Are Incorrect
column31:
Select Account Owner options are not correct.

* If there is no Joint Owner, the JO option should not be displayed.
* If there is not a Joint Annuitant, the JA option should not be displayed but it is displayed. See screenshot.

!image-20250522-134335.png|width=1239,height=491,alt="image-20250522-134335.png"!

This is working correctly:

If you pick an option besides “Other” the Account Holder Name defaults from the prior pages correctly including iff the Annuitant or Joint Owner is selected and is “Same as Owner.” 



Impact of the defect is low - if the user picks a role / option that doesn’t exist on the e-App the Account Holder Name is read-only and they’ll get and error that it’s required. However, the user should know that there is no Joint Owner or Joint Annuitant so this problem is likely to happen infrequently.

column1: Finance Reconciliation Issue
column31:
attached updated account strings for the suspense deposit and premium application events. In the attached, the suspense deposit event (when cash is received) is recorded as an increase in cash and increase in suspense. When premium is applied in the subsequent premium application step, the suspense liability is removed and replaced with the premium deposit fund liability. The net of the 2 events is to increase cash and deposit liability (suspense 0'ed out) for the premium amount.

!image-20250522-010705.png|width=428,height=451,alt="image-20250522-010705.png"!

column1: Task API/report Creation Date Field:
column31:
As part of the Task API, we need a field that will display the date the task was created and not be editable. This is needed so that they can pull all tasks created on a certain date.

Add a new field in excel - call it "Creation Date" and default it to "CurrentDate"

We need to also provide a place for the input as well with a range like we have for LastModifiedDateTimeStamp, so will need to add two more parameters - CreationDateStart and CreationDateEnd.We will then need to modify the report as well. The report name is TaskList and is available under the AskMax-Config category. We need to include this new field in the report.
column291: 27/May/25 12:30 PM;712020:7d9448a6-787c-4e6b-80bf-100866d5d019;new field added to the TaskList report payload will be "TaskCreatedDate" [~accountid:712020:9118650d-5237-41a5-8f70-901aacb766e1]

column1: Add an initial paperwork review requirement to the agent onboarding and Task
column31:
As CeresLife, we need FAST to add an initial paperwork review step to the agent onboarding process. This requirement will be before any other requirement is created and once closed the normal process can begin. 

Task - Created = Initial Paperwork Review



*Acceptance Criteria:* 

# A new Agent contract is sent to FAST
# initial paperwork review requirement is created
# Task is created and dropped in Agent Review Queue
# Requirement gets closed → Task also closes
# once closed the rest of the agent onboarding requirements are generated

column1: [Forms]Test Forms & 103: Change Pages & Data when Annuitant Roles and Joint Annuitant Roles Options Changes
column31:
Need to assign a Ceres Tester (Lynn or someone from Ops) to test Forms and 103 when we’re able and have time - we cannot see forms and submit the 103 today:

Ensure the information on the application and ACORD PDFs are correct if you  

# Answer “No, another person” then 
# Enter some Annuitant information and Save/Proceed, then 
# Change the answer on the Annuitant Roles page back to “Yes, the Owner” then 
# Ensure the Annuitant page is no longer present then
# Ensure the Signature Information represents the correct roles and names for signers then
# Review the a.) App PDF and ACORD PDF and b.) the [103 or Case in FAST] to make sure the Owner and Annuitant are represented the same person, signatures are correctly applied, and the other information entered in step 2 is not present. 

Similarly, test Joint Annuitant with the same method.



Adding this Jira because I noticed that sometimes when you change the selected option on the Annuitant Roles and/or Joint Annuitant Roles pages 

1.) Sometimes the Annuitant page and Joint Annuitant page isn’t removed when going from No to Yes, and

2.) If you enter some Annuitant and Joint Annuitant information, then change to [“Yes, the Owner” or “Yes, the Joint Owner”] the page may become hidden. If then you change the answer back to “No, another person” the original information is still present on the e-App which means it wasn’t deleted when the Yes was selected.

column1: Run GIACT on Agent Creation
column31: As CeresLife, we need GIACT to run on agent submission to check the agent bank account details.

column1: Reflexive Information + Pages Do Not Change with Type of Ownership Change
column31:
If you change the Type of Ownership, the reflexive pages that are created are not removed and associated data deleted. 

If you selected a ToO value, proceeded through some of the Applicant Information pages, then realized you made the wrong selection and go back to change it.



For example, if you change from Joint to Natural Person, the Joint Owner page does not go away. Likewise, Trust to another value, the Trust page isn’t removed.

This screenshot was taken after entering information, then returning to change Joint to Natural Person, then clicking Proceed to get to the owenr page, then returning to Product.

!image-20250521-193154.png|width=624,height=584,alt="image-20250521-193154.png"!



Unless iLife indicates the solution is quick and easy, LMG recommends that this correction is supported post-launch due to the risk a correction may cause.

column1: Can Sell Fail Reflexive "Yes" Text: Product Training, E&O, AML Training
column31:
In order to improve the user experience and help them understand when an e-App can go to signatures and when it cannot - and until [https://3clife.atlassian.net/browse/CL-437|https://3clife.atlassian.net/browse/CL-437|smart-link] is completed - modify the informational text that appears when “Yes” is selected.



The business requirements has been updated - changes are noted in orange and dated 5/21/25 in that spreadsheet. This list of 3 changes (below) includes both the existing text and the new replacement text.

* AN_MG_44: (Product Training results for Can Sell “false” response) Replace this text “If so, please attach the Certificate of Completion to this e-App.” with this: _You have overridden the Product Training error to allow this e-App to be signed and submitted. This application cannot be issued until our records are updated. Please attach the agent’s Certificate of Completion using the Documents page._ 

* AN_MG_45: (AML Training response to Can Sell “false” response) Replace this text “If so, please attach the Certificate of Completion to this e-App.” with this: _You have overridden the AML Training error to allow this e-App to be signed and submitted. This application cannot be issued until our records are updated._ _Please attach the agent’s Certificate of Completion using the Documents page._ 
* AN_MG_46:  (E&O response for Can Sell “false” response):  Replace this text: “If so, please attach proof of insurance to this e-App” with:  _You have overridden the E&O error to allow this e-App to be signed and submitted. This application cannot be issued until our records are updated._ _Please attach the agent’s proof of insurance using the Documents page._ 



5/21/25 LMG: as discussed with Eric as an alternative to 437 which is more labor intensive to resolve.

column1: Systematic withdrawal confirmations letters are generating with an incorrect letter date
column31:
Description: 
Systematic withdrawal confirmations letters are generating with a letter date that is pulling from the start date of the disbursements instead of the effective date of the transaction.

If issue related to iLife eApp: 
Policy Number: 0100

Expected Behavior:  
Date of letter should default to the date of the transaction instead of the start date of the payments.

System(s) Impacts: 
Client letters for systematic withdrawals are generating with the wrong confirmation letter date.

column1: Did not receive "must be a person" error on Agent Search result
column31:
The Agent Search API returns an indicator regarding whether the agent is a person on agency. If the agent is an agency, an error is expected but it is not received.

“The writing agent must be a person not an agency.” 

This message is expected to be displayed under the writing agent information with the Can Sell message, not as a toaster message.

!image-20250520-211040.png|width=2830,height=648,alt="image-20250520-211040.png"!



Note: Per Rich at FAST, there is no automated validation in FAST when the e-App is submitted or when it’s issued to ensure agencies are not writing agents.

If this Jira is not prioritized for launch, I suggest adding it as a manual validation/checklist item.

column1: Writing Code Not Found - Error Temporary | No Agent Errors Received
column31:
An e-App can be submitted without valid agent information (invalid Writing Code, didn’t pass can sell).

When the Writing Code is invalid, a “toaster” message that is temporary is received. However, the error disappears very quickly - it’s gone when the agent’s first & last name, email and split percent required errors are displayed. 

If you enter the required information, there are no other errors present and the nav circle turns green.

There may not be an appointment error if the Jurisdiction is a Just In Time state, but there should be all other “Can Sell” errors: license, term status (false), product training, AML training, E&O. These errors are not displayed. In addition, there should be an error that the agent is not a person from the “Agent Search” API.

See policy number 3524.

!image-20250520-205520.png|width=1202,height=424,alt="image-20250520-205520.png"!

column1: Owner Name Page is Incorrect
column31:
The name of the Owner page is not correct when the Type of Ownership is Entity or Trust. The name should always be “Owner” regardless of the Type of Ownership. The Owner is the Owner, the Type of Ownership is used to drive which fields are present on the Owner page (and whether the Joint Owner page should be presented, etc.). 

If Type of Ownership is Entity, it now says “Entity” rather than “Owner.” This is confusing because you may not know what page you’re on (the name of the page on the left nav doesn’t highlight, bold or otherwise indicate which page you’re on). The page could be an entity beneficiary.

!image-20250520-194026.png|width=719,height=381,alt="image-20250520-194026.png"!



Likewise, when the Type of Ownership = Trust, it says “Trust” rather than “Owner.” In addition, there is already a page called Trust (which was not as we’d defined but is ok for launch).

!image-20250520-194400.png|width=745,height=471,alt="image-20250520-194400.png"!

!image-20250520-194426.png|width=685,height=521,alt="image-20250520-194426.png"!

It is correct when the Owner is Natural Person or Joint:

!image-20250520-194517.png|width=740,height=530,alt="image-20250520-194517.png"!

column1: c3life | feature: create S3 bucket and IAM role via Terraform and deploy jamfprotect-s3-forwarding-bucket-cloudformation.yml in shareduse1
column31:
use terraform to create the required s3 bucket and iam role for jamf protect integration. after the terraform resources are provisioned, deploy the cloudformation yaml {{jamfprotect-s3-forwarding-bucket-cloudformation.yml}} in the {{shareduse1}} environment.

Task:

* provision the following resources using terraform:
** iam role: {{c3lshared1use1-jamf-role}}
** s3 bucket: {{c3lshared1use1-jamf-bucket}}
* deploy the {{jamfprotect-s3-forwarding-bucket-cloudformation.yml}} after the terraform deployment is successful.
* ensure all resources are created in the {{shareduse1}} region.

*JamfProtect-S3-Forwarding-Bucket-CloudFormation.yml*  

AWSTemplateFormatVersion: 2010-09-09
Parameters:
  JamfProtectBucketName:
    Type: String
    AllowedPattern: '(?!(^xn--|-s3alias$))^[a-z0-9][a-z0-9-]{1,61}[a-z0-9]$'
    Description: Bucket to write Jamf Protect data to.
Resources:
  JamfProtectBucket:
    Type: AWS::S3::Bucket
    Properties:
      BucketName: !Ref JamfProtectBucketName
      BucketEncryption:
        ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration:
          - ServerSideEncryptionByDefault:
              SSEAlgorithm: AES256
      PublicAccessBlockConfiguration:
        BlockPublicAcls: true
        BlockPublicPolicy: true
        IgnorePublicAcls: true
        RestrictPublicBuckets: true
  JamfProtectBucketPolicy:
    Type: AWS::S3::BucketPolicy
    Properties:
      Bucket: !Ref JamfProtectBucketName
      PolicyDocument:
        Statement:
          - Sid: DenyUnSecureCommunications
            Effect: Deny
            Principal:
              AWS: "_"_
            _Action:_
              _- s3:_
            Resource: !Sub arn:${AWS::Partition}:s3:::${JamfProtectBucketName}/*
            Condition:
              Bool:
                aws:SecureTransport:
                  - "false"
          - Sid: DenyIncorrectEncryptionHeader
            Effect: Deny
            Principal: "_"_
            _Action:_
              _- s3:PutObject_
            _Resource: !Sub arn:${AWS::Partition}:s3:::${JamfProtectBucketName}/_
            Condition:
              StringNotEquals:
                s3:x-amz-server-side-encryption:
                  - AES256
          - Sid: DenyUnEncryptedObjectUploads
            Effect: Deny
            Principal: "_"_
            _Action:_
              _- s3:PutObject_
            _Resource: !Sub arn:${AWS::Partition}:s3:::${JamfProtectBucketName}/_
            Condition:
              "Null":
                s3:x-amz-server-side-encryption:
                  - "true"
  JamfProtectWriterRole:
    Type: AWS::IAM::Role
    Properties:
      AssumeRolePolicyDocument:
        Version: 2012-10-17
        Statement:
          - Effect: Allow
            Principal:
              AWS: arn:aws:iam::147681526064:root
            Action:
              - "sts:AssumeRole"
            Condition:
              StringEquals:
                sts:ExternalId:
                  - "661f60d0-2176-4c39-b5de-5ca97d41b67e"
      Policies:
        - PolicyName: S3PutPolicy
          PolicyDocument:
            Version: 2012-10-17
            Statement:
              - Effect: Allow
                Action:
                  - s3:PutObject
                Resource:
                  - !Sub arn:${AWS::Partition}:s3:::${JamfProtectBucketName}/*
Outputs:
  JamfProtectWriterRoleArn:
    Value: !GetAtt JamfProtectWriterRole.Arn
  JamfProtectBucket:
    Value: !Ref JamfProtectBucketName

[^JamfProtect-S3-Forwarding-Bucket-CloudFormation.yml]

Note: 

* IAM role should be created through IAM roles package
* S3 bucket should be created through S3 package

SPIKE: What drives the accounting and distribution channel for a disbursement
column31:
We are noticing that for disbursements they are not showing up in the ACH file. The distribution type for these is check and the payment type is EFT. 



If we want to pay EFT should we be able to choose the distribution type as EFT?

Cases below (note the columns are switched)

column1: New Task Type - Correspondence Exception
column31:
As ceresLife, we need a new task type “Correspondance Exception”. This will be the task type we’ll use when creating a task for outbound correspondence failures due to bad email addresses and fax numbers.



*Acceptance Criteria:* There will be this new task type that we can trigger programatically and add two a queue of our choice. 

Fast will provide us with the ne task type ID

column293:
10/Jun/25 9:08 AM;712020:9118650d-5237-41a5-8f70-901aacb766e1;Here is the correct Json input for the api. 

{noformat}{
  "timeStamp": "2025-06-10T08:16:40.298Z",
  "summary": "Test Notes Summary 002",
  "content": "Test Notes Content 002",
  "priority": "Low",
  "alertUntilDate": "2025-06-10T08:16:40.300Z",
  "alert": true,
  "role": "224"
}{noformat}

Priority can take values Low, High, Normal

_There was some issue with the mapping of role field,_ the fix is applied and will be available with next build/deploy. 

Role can take codes from Cm_Cfg_Rol_Role_S entity.
