column1: Suitability Consumer Profile Form - Fields are not Printing
column31:
Suitability Consumer Profile Form

 

These fields are not printing:

 

* Page 1
** Policy Number
** 1c. Owner’s Age
** 1g. Owner’s SSN
** 2b. Joint Owner’s DOB
** The font size of the Joint Owner’s name is much larger than other fields.
* Page 2
** 3. Total Initial Expected Premium
** 4. Active military = No is not checked
* Page 3
** 6. Losses checkbox is not checked.
* Page 4:
** 10a. Risk tolerance checkbox is not checked.
** 12. Contract guar interest period is not printed – it should be equal to the Term of the new annuity (3-years or 5-years or 7-years)
* Page 5 - 6:
** 2b. Change in future income is not checked.
** 3. Adequate resources is not checked.
** Only question #6 is printed in Section 4.
* Page 6:
** The font size of the Owner & Joint Owner’s name is too big.
* Page 7:
** Submitting supplemental information is not checked.

column1: Application PDF Form Defects
column31:
[^MYGA_Application.pdf]

* Page 1:
** Not printed:
*** Policy Number 
*** Owner’s email
*** Owner SSN/TIN identifier checkbox
*** Owner SSN
** Some of the text is in black and some is in blue; all printed text not in the template should be in blue.

 

* Page 2:
** Not printed: 
*** Joint Owner’s DOB
*** Joint Owner’s Residence State (see below)
*** Joint Owner’s Residence Zip (see below)
*** Joint Owner’s email.
*** Joint Owner’s Mailing Address State has 2 states in it – and Zip has 2 zips in it.
** Joint Owner’s Marital Status is not correct – should be Married but Singled is checked.
** The Joint Owner is the Annuitant but the Annuitant Information section is not completed.
*** Perhaps we should state that rather than printing it? “Complete only if different from owner.”

 

* Page 3 and 4
** Not printed:
*** Beneficiary’s name
*** Beneficiary’s SSN checkbox is not checked.

 

* Page 5
** Not printed:
*** Total Expected Initial Premium
*** Amount associated with Non-Qualified Transfer of Assets.
*** Remarks

 

* Page 6 and 8
** Owner’s Signed At City has 2 states in it.

 

* Page 9
** Most fields are not printed - only the 1^st^ question is printed.

 

* Page 10 Agent’s printed in name is missing.

column1: CLONE - Tax Withholding Amount Mismatch on Partial Surrender
column31:
Description: 
When the user processed the transaction, the Disbursement Quote screen displayed the below amounts for tax w/h:
Fed w/h: $1,409.50
State w/h: $281.90
Net Amount: $12,403.59

After the transaction processed, the amounts were updated to the below:
Fed w/h: $1,866.50
State w/h: $373.30
Net Amount: $11,855.19

If issue related to iLife eApp: 
Policy Number: M000000129

Expected Behavior:  
Tax withholding values quoted in the Disbursement Quote screen should match the values after the transaction processes.

_Issue created in Slack from a_ [_message_|https://3clife.slack.com/archives/C08NRSAS9UK/p1747427337931669]_._

column1: CLONE - Partial Surrender Value Mismatches
column31:
Description: 
Reviewing the processed partial surrender on policy M000000103, there are some data discrepancies.

A partial withdrawal was submitted on 5/14 using 25,000 Net. When clicking through the processed transaction, the Amount Requested under Disbursement Details is listed as $24,705.50 as well as the Amount under Taxable Parties. The Disbursement Quote screen shows a net amount of 25k as expected and a Gross amount of $32,556.40. Under the Payee Detail screen, the Net Disb Amt is listed as $25k, which is expected.

When looking at the Results -> Summary tab under the transaction, there are various fields that are in questions:
Amount Processed: $24,705.50
Amount Disbursed: $25,622.74
YTD Withdrawals: $24,705.50
Cumulative Withdrawals: $24,705.50
Difference between Starting Account Value ($250,700.25) and Account Value ($225,994.75): $24,705.50.

Reviewing the General Ledger, it appears that the correct amount of $25,000 would of been processed and sent out in the ACH file.

If issue related to iLife eApp: 
Policy Number: M000000103
Application ID: 
eApp Page/Function:
eApp Phase: 
eApp Field: 

Expected Behavior:  
The concern is that values quoted while the user was processing the transaction were different than what the transaction processed for. Also a concern that backend values are not correct.

When a user processes a transaction, the values under the Disbursement Quote screen should match what the transaction processes for during the nightly cycle.

_Issue created in Slack from a_ [_message_|https://3clife.slack.com/archives/C08NRSAS9UK/p1747426915154679]_._
